title: Canadian PM Mark Carney likely to visit India in early March, India’s envoy to Canada says
content: Formal negotiations for a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement with India should also start in March, India’s ​High Commissioner to Canada Dinesh Patnaik says

title: All set for annual celestial wedding at Antarvedi temple in Konaseema
content: The devotees will take part in the procession of the chariot on January 29 and take holy dip the next day in the confluence point of Godavari into sea at Antarvedi

title: India-EU FTA negotiations done, to be announced on February 27: Commerce Secretary
content: Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said that while the closure of negotiations will be announced, the actual deal will be signed once the language goes through legal scrubbing

title: Naidu pushes technology-driven governance, names 2026 decision-making year
content: Chief Minister stresses use of AI and digital tools to reduce field staff workload, speed up grievance redressal and improve service delivery across departments

title: Godavari Delta to be surveyed at cost of over ₹13 crore
content: Eight pacts signed to attract ₹58,850 crore investments in Kakinada district during CII-Visakhapatnam summit-2025; A fleet of 50 EV buses to be deployed in East Godavari by 2026 end

title: Nori Dattatreyudu expresses delight after Padma Bhushan honour
content: This recognition from my own country, my people, and my government holds special significance, says the noted radiation oncologist

title: Eluru Collector calls for dedicated efforts for district’s development on R-Day
content: She highlights the government’s achievements, including financial assistance to over 1.6 lakh farmers, distribution of mechanised farming equipment, procurement of Kharif crops, among others

title: Congress tries out year-round grassroots mobilisation model in Jharkhand
content: AICC in-charge K. Raju has drawn up a year-long calendar of activities involving party workers and leaders across nearly 4,350 gram panchayats in the State

title: AP Transco aims to complete 55 transmission projects this year: Joint MD
content: Projects worth ₹9,320 crore to add 8,853 MVA capacity and 1,558 circuit km lines to strengthen State power grid, he says

title: Kashmiri will survive in grief, sorrow and lament: Padma Shri nominee Shauq
content: Shafi Shauq described the Padma Shri award, among the highest civilian honours in India, as “an acknowledgement of the richness of Kashmiri language”

title: Mayawati reiterates demand of Bharat Ratna for BSP founder Kanshi Ram
content: On Republic Day, Bahujan Samaj Party leader calls for an ‘honest assessment’ of whether Central and State governments have made ‘much-needed improvement in the standard of living of the people’

title: Eluru Collector honours Information department staff for exemplary services
content: According to district administration, their consistent dedication and professional excellence earned them accolades

title: Andhra Pradesh Speaker proposes Right to Recall, no work no pay for MLAs
content: Speaking at the 77th Republic Day celebrations at the State Assembly,  Ayyanna Patrudu calls for a minimum of 60 sitting days a year to restore the dignity of legislatures, while Legislative Council Chairman Koyye Moshenu Raju hails the Constitution as the greatest guiding text

title: State likely to set up committee for Gig Workers’ Welfare Board today
content: The board will have 15 members, with representation from the government, gig workers, aggregator bodies and civil society

title: Suspected militants torch houses, farmhouses in Manipur’s Kangpokpi district
content: The Zeliangrong United Front (ZUF) has claimed responsibility for the act and alleged that the houses and farmhouses were being used by illicit poppy cultivators

title: A.P. Food Safety department tightens focus on sale of cotton candy
content: Despite containing harmful colouring agent Rhodamine B, the use of which is prohibited in the State, the sale of cotton candy continues in public gatherings in Vijayawada, including the recent Vijayawada Book Festival

title: Constitution guiding force for democracy, judiciary, says Andhra Pradesh High Court Chief Justice
content: Justice Thakur highlights judiciary’s role in social change, urges citizens to preserve India’s social fabric on 77th Republic Day

title: Punjab farmers take out tractor marches demanding withdrawal of Electricity (Amendment) Bill
content: The demonstrations were organised to demand the withdrawal of the Electricity (Amendment) Bill 2025, the Seeds Bill 2025, repeal of labour codes, restoration of the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act and legal guarantee for minimum support price on crops

title: Three killed, four injured as car crashes into truck on Tumakuru highway
content: Preliminary investigation suggests that the car was overspeeding and rammed the truck from behind. The impact was severe, leaving the car completely mangled and trapping the occupants inside the vehicle

title: Two from Mysuru dead as boat capsizes near Malpe
content: Though all 14 tourists aboard the boat were given life jackets, none was wearing it at the time of the incident.

title: A.P. govt. restored stability, rebuilt confidence after a lack of direction for years: Governor
content: Speaking in the Republic Day celebrations in Amaravati, Governor Abdul Nazeer says Amaravati was being developed with renewed vigour, having secured financial closures for key projects including the N5 and E3 roads and the Governor’s Residence Complex

title: Watch: 77th Republic Day parade highlights
content: India ushered in its 77th Republic Day on Monday (January 26, 2026) with a grand display of its military prowess that included missiles, warplanes, newly-raised units and lethal weapon systems used during Operation Sindoor.

title: Patta transfer in Tamil Nadu: Officials asked to digitally process applications
content: The Director of Survey and Settlement has instructed Collectors and Assistant Directors of Survey and Land Records not to process manual note files and not to manually approve sub-division statements by Tahsildars.

title: Uttarakhand’s Char Dham temples want ban on entry of non-Hindus
content: The four shrines are the backbone of the State’s economy and are visited by millions of people from across India every year

title: Daily Quiz: On Republic Day invitees over the years
content: Since 1950, India has officially hosted a head of State or an official from another country as a chief guest/guest of honour for the Republic Day. A quiz on such invitees over the years.

title: Karnataka farmers urge Union Government to recommend to WHO to re-classify arecanut from ‘carcinogenic’ to ‘possibly carcinogenic to humans’
content: CAMPCO president S. R. Satishchandra writes to Union Health Minister J. P. Nadda, other Union Ministers, CMs of Karnataka and Kerala in view of WHO hosting a webinar on arecanut on January 30

title: Forces widen search operation in J&K’s Kishtwar to hunt down terrorists
content: The encounter took place in the snow-bound Janseer-Kandiwar forest area of Chatroo on January 25, 2026, after one of the security search parties observed the movement of terrorists

title: Gavaskar gushes over India's depth ahead of T20 World Cup
content: Sunil Gavaskar underlined India's depth as India took an unassailable 3-0 lead in the five-match series with a scintillating eight-wicket win in Guwahati on January 25

title: 77th Republic Day: The celebration in pictures
content: The 77th Republic Day was celebrated across the country with vibrant and grand parade centered around the theme ‘150 Years of Vande Mataram’, with New Delhi’s Kartavya Path leading the national festivities

title: Operation Sindoor: IAF achieved air superiority over Pakistan by May 10, says Swiss Defence think tank
content: The report reveals that India’s ability to sustain stand-off attacks depended largely on the availability of advanced munitions such as BrahMos and SCALP-EG cruise missiles.

title: Survey of land cultivated by Sharavati project-affected people in Karnataka completed, report will be submitted to court soon: Minister Madhu Bangarappa
content: He said that the government of Karnataka had taken special interest to resolve the issue concerning people displaced by the project and would make honest efforts to provide justice to the affected persons

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹1,986.48 crore in PACL case
content: “Accused entities and individuals operated an illegal collective investment scheme, fraudulently mobilising more than ₹60,000 crore from lakhs of investors across India under the guise of the sale and development of agricultural land,” says ED

title: ₹10,000 crore development projects taken up in Mysuru district along with guarantee schemes: Minister H. C. Mahadevappa
content: The projects listed by Minister for Social Welfare H.C. Mahadevappa included the proposed construction of a hospital on the lines of NIMHANS and a de-addiction centre at a cost of ₹100 crore in the district

title: Maintaining rule of law is the government’s highest priority, says Bihar Governor Arif Mohammad Khan
content: Praising the Nitish Kumar government, Mr. Khan said, compared to 2005, there has been a significant reduction in incidents of murder, robbery, dacoity, and kidnapping for ransom in the State

title: Telangana vision document in line with the Viksit Bharat goal of India: Governor
content: “The Ambitious ‘Telangana Rising – Vision 2047’ document, which provides a comprehensive roadmap for inclusive and sustainable development, was in alignment with the national goal of Viksit Bharat 2047,” says Telangana Governor

title: Madhya Pradesh to observe 2026 as ‘Year of Agriculture’, focus on farmer welfare: Governor
content: The Madhya Pradesh Governor said that multi-pronged efforts are being made to make Madhya Pradesh the milk capital of the country and to transform animal husbandry into a profitable business

title: Government working for all-round development in Tripura, says Governor Indrasena Reddy
content: The Tripura Governor said the government has taken steps to double the income of the farmers because 70% of the population depend on the farming sector

title: Barnwell: What went right for the Seahawks, Patriots -- and wrong for the Rams, Broncos -- on Sunday
content: The Seahawks and Patriots both won one-score conference title games -- but in very different fashions. What did we learn about the Super Bowl-bound teams?

title: First look at Seahawks-Patriots: Early Super Bowl picks, big questions, key matchups
content: Ahead of the Feb. 8 showdown, we have predictions, matchup insight, looming questions and team breakdowns.

title: Darnold 'shut a lot of people up,' Macdonald says
content: Sam Darnold answered questions about his big-game ability resoundingly, leading the Seahawks to a win over the Rams in the NFC Championship Game on Sunday night.

title: Stafford mum on future as Rams left reeling in loss
content: Matthew Stafford declined to discuss if he'd be back next season after the Rams suffered a heartbreaking loss to the Seahawks in the NFC title game.

title: Vrabel: Pats' turnaround rooted in belief, identity
content: The Patriots completed a remarkable turnaround under coach Mike Vrabel, earning a trip to the Super Bowl after winning just eight games total the past two seasons.

title: Payton rues 4th-down call after stalling in snow
content: Broncos coach Sean Payton said he will find several "regrets'' in Sunday's AFC Championship Game loss to the Patriots, most notably when he passed up points in the second quarter.

title: 'Disgusted' Stewart protests shooting with sign
content: Unrivaled co-founder and two-time WNBA MVP Breanna Stewart held up an "Abolish ICE" sign during player introductions at Unrivaled on Sunday afternoon.

title: Sources: Giants hire Wilson as Harbaugh's DC
content: The Giants are hiring former Titans defensive coordinator Dennard Wilson for the same role on John Harbaugh's staff, sources told ESPN's Dan Graziano and Jordan Raanan on Sunday.

title: New year, same result: Scheffler wins AmEx by 4
content: Scottie Scheffler ran off four birdies in a six-hole stretch Sunday to blow past 18-year-old Blades Brown and the rest of the field, closing with a 6-under 66 for a four-shot victory at The American Express.

title: Sports Broadcasting Hall of Famer Mason dies
content: Geoffrey Mason, whose career spanned five decades across ABC Sports, ESPN, NBC, Fox, the NFL Network and other networks, died Sunday at the age of 85.

title: Inside Sean Payton's fourth-down Broncos-Patriots call
content: Behind the scenes with Denver Broncos coach Sean Payton, before and after his failed fourth-down decision.

title: Offensive battle leads to a Seahawks win, a berth to Super Bowl LX
content: Seattle defeats Los Angeles in the NFC Championship Game and advances to Super Bowl LX to face the Patriots.

title: Should Milwaukee seek a Giannis trade? State of the Bucks, plus what 29 teams can offer
content: If the Bucks open trade talks for Giannis Antetokounmpo, which teams have the players, draft picks and contracts to get a deal done?

title: Fires, destruction and hope: One year later for JJ Redick, the Lakers and Los Angeles
content: A year after fires burned across Los Angeles, Redick has become a public face of the rebuild and seen firsthand the generosity of those around him.

title: Is defeating Madison Keys the breakthrough Jessica Pegula needed?
content: Pegula dismantled the defending champ's game and looked like a player ready to win a Grand Slam title.

title: My first bet for Super Bowl LX: Back Seattle's offense in a high-scoring matchup
content: It's time for the biggest sports betting event of the year. Here's your first betting guide to Super Bowl LX.

title: Super Bowl LX: Odds, trends, past winners and MVPs
content: Odds and trends for Super Bowl LX, plus the updated spread, line, total and FPI projection for the big game.

title: Get ready for the Senior Bowl: Six predictions and 15 NFL draft prospects to watch in Mobile
content: Our NFL draft experts weigh in on what to expect at the Senior Bowl, from picking out position groups to watch to predicting players who could rise.

title: Lessons from Man United's victory at Arsenal; Real Madrid win ugly; Liverpool woe; more
content: Man United look better post-Ruben Amorim. Can they keep it going? And how quickly can Arsenal move past Sunday's loss? Plus: Real Madrid win ugly and Liverpool continue to suffer, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Does anyone want to win the Premier League?
content: A Man United title triumph is unlikely scenario, but a  12-point gap is nothing in this crazy season.

title: UFC 324 grades: First fight card of the year sets a high bar
content: Five early finishes at UFC 324 were topped by a stellar title fight between Justin Gaethje and Paddy Pimblett.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold
content: Real Madrid's Trent Alexander-Arnold is being targeted for a return to the Premier League with Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Congress Fumes Over Rahul Gandhi's 3rd Row R-Day Seat. What The Rules Say
content: Leaders of the Opposition in Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha, Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi, attended the Republic Day parade function at Delhi's Kartavya Path today.

title: Minister Apologises After Row Over Omitting BR Ambedkar From R-Day Speech
content: A Forest Department personnel tried to interrupt the Republic Day speech of Maharashtra minister Girish Mahajan in Nashik on Monday for not mentioning Dr B R Ambedkar, prompting him to apologise for what he described as an unintentional omission.

title: Video: Naga Insurgents Claim To Burn Poppy Farms, Kukis Allege Attack In Manipur's Kangpokpi
content: Some structures including huts at a village in Manipur's Kangpokpi district were set on fire by insurgents today. The Zeliangrong United Front (ZUF) in a statement to the media claimed responsibility.

title: 3 Dead, 6 Missing As Massive Fire Ravages Kolkata Warehouse
content: The Police on Monday confirmed the death of three people in a massive fire at a warehouse in the Anandapur area on the southern outskirts of Kolkata, while several others are still missing.

title: Former Dhaka Police Chief, 2 Cops Sentenced to Death By Bangladesh Tribunal
content: Former Dhaka police commissioner and two other police officers were on Monday sentenced to death by a special Bangladesh tribunal for their alleged role during the 2024 violent street protests that led to then Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster.

title: BJP MP 'Predicts' President's Rule In Bengal, Trinamool Leaders React
content: A political slugfest surfaced in West Bengal on Monday over a statement hinting at possible President's Rule in the state by the former judge of Calcutta High Court and the current BJP Lok Sabha MP Abhijit Gangopadhyay.

title: Air Force's Subtle Message By Showcasing Unseen Weaponry On Fighter Jets
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) today silenced cynical naysayers, who alleged it did not use the weapons it claimed to have used during the strikes deep inside Pakistan in 2019 (Balakot) and during Operation Sindoor last year.

title: Dismissed From Job, Home Guard Attempts Suicide At Collector's Office
content: A Home Guard jawan dismissed from service allegedly attempted suicide by consuming pesticide inside the Collectorate in Chhattisgarh's Korba city on Monday, police said.

title: EU Opens Probe Into Elon Musk's Grok Over Sexual AI Deepfakes
content: The EU on Monday hit Elon Musk's X with an investigation over AI chatbot Grok's generation of sexualised deepfake images of women and minors, in the latest step of an international backlash against the tool.

title: Why Opposition Is Unhappy With Padma Honour To Maharashtra's Ex-Governor
content: Bhagat Singh Koshyari was conferred with the Padma Bhushan award yesterday, nearly three years after he resigned as the Maharashtra governor.

title: Canada PM Mark Carney Likely To Visit India In March, Sign Deals On Uranium
content: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney will likely visit India the first week of March and sign deals on uranium, energy, minerals and artificial intelligence, Dinesh Patnaik, India's High Commissioner to Canada said in an interview.

title: Sufi Poet Baba Bulleh Shah's Shrine Vandalised In Mussoorie, Case Filed
content: Mussoorie Kotwali police have registered a case against three named accused in connection with the alleged vandalism of the shrine of renowned Sufi poet Baba Bulleh Shah, police said on Sunday.

title: On Republic Day, J&K Honours Man Who Died Fighting Terrorists In Pahalgam
content: The Jammu and Kashmir government has honoured 56 individuals for their bravery, including Adil Hussain Shah, who tragically lost his life while saving tourists during the Pahalgam terror attack in April 2025.

title: China Warns Citizens Against Travelling To Japan During Lunar New Year
content: China warned its citizens on Monday against travelling to Japan during the upcoming Lunar New Year holiday, citing deteriorating public security, with Tokyo and Beijing locked in a diplomatic spat.

title: Ayurvedic College Student Found Dead In UP, Family Alleges Murder
content: A first-year student from Delhi was found dead under suspicious circumstances at an ayurvedic college here, triggering protests by his family members, police said on Monday.

title: "Hindi Devoured Many Languages": Udhayanidhi Stalin's Big Charge Ahead Of Polls
content: Tamil Nadu Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin on Sunday launched a sharp attack on what he termed "Hindi imposition," warning that the language has "devoured" several regional mother tongues across India.

title: Badrinath-Kedarnath To Ban Non-Hindus? Temple Panel To Pass Proposal Soon
content: Only Hindus will soon be allowed to enter the Badrinath and Kedarnath temples nestled in the lap of the Himalayas in Uttarakhand.

title: Donald Trump's "Historic Bond" Message For India On 77th Republic Day
content: US President Donald Trump wished India as it celebrated its 77th Republic Day today, with a post on social media that had a black and white photo of him and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Schoolgirl Tasked With Transporting Chairs, Dies After Falling Off Auto In Telangana
content: A class 8 student died after slipping and falling off an autorickshaw while transporting some chairs to her principal's house in Telangana's Kamareddy district.

title: 11 Personnel Injured In IED Blasts During Anti-Maoist Ops In Chhattisgarh
content: Eleven security personnel were injured after improvised explosive devices (IEDs) planted by Maoists went off during an anti-Naxalite operation in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, an official said on Monday.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Innovation, bold leadership key to nation’s progress: N.V.S. Reddy
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: 'Taking gomutra to world': Cong's snide remark on Padma Shri awardee sparks row
content: A political row erupted on social media after the Congress questioned IIT Madras director V Kamakoti's Padma Shri award, linking it to research on cow dung and urine. Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu strongly defended Kamakoti, highlighting his deep tech expertise and the scientific potential of traditional substances, criticizing a "slavish colonial mindset."

title: ‘No more hostages in Gaza’: IDF recovers last captive held by Hamas; remains repatriated to Israel
content: The Israeli military has recovered the remains of Ran Gvili, the last hostage held in Gaza, confirming all abductees have been returned to Israel. Prime Minister Netanyahu hailed this as an extraordinary achievement, fulfilling a promise to bring everyone back. Hamas stated the discovery confirms their commitment to the ceasefire agreement.

title: T20 WC row: PCB considers boycotting India match in support of Bangladesh
content: Pakistan's T20 World Cup participation hangs in the balance, with a decision on playing against co-hosts India delayed until at least Friday. Discussions are underway regarding a potential boycott in solidarity with Bangladesh, who were removed from the tournament. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has directed the cricket board to explore all options.

title: Microsoft and Amazon take out full-page ad, warn Washington faces ‘emergency’
content: Tech giants Microsoft and Amazon, usually fierce rivals, have joined forces to tackle Washington State's severe housing crisis.  The companies jointly penned an op-ed, pledging $1.6 billion to build over 26,000 affordable homes for the community. They urge policymakers to prioritize policies that simplify and expedite construction, warning that inaction risks further economic decline and talent loss.

title: Europe wants to reduce dependence on US tech companies: What is Digital Sovereignty
content: The European Parliament is pushing for "European technological sovereignty" to reduce reliance on US tech giants, urging accelerated regulatory reforms and investments in digital infrastructure. This initiative aims to shield critical sectors like cloud computing, semiconductors, and AI from foreign influence, ensuring greater control over digital assets and citizen data.

title: Hypersonic missiles, phased battle array & Op Sindoor: India flexes might on 77th R-Day parade
content: India celebrates its 77th Republic Day on Monday, with nationwide events marking the adoption of the Constitution and highlighting the country’s cultural and military heritage. Celebrations of the 77th Republic Day at the Kartvya Path were based on the theme of the 150th Anniversary of the national song, Vande Mataram, a timeless mantra that awakened the spirit of Swadeshi, self-reliance, and freedom in India's national consciousness.

title: 'They don't want to give visa': One-year-long waiting list for H-1B interviews
content: Indian professionals face significant H-1B visa disruptions as new stamping dates are unavailable this year, with interviews deferred to 2027. US consulates in India report no regular slots, and experts see no immediate improvement. Stricter US visa policies, including social media screening and a ban on third-country stamping, are contributing to the severe delays and visa revocations.

title: Microsoft tells engineers to use Claude Code and GitHub Copilot, report which works better
content: Microsoft is having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in Anthropic's AI coding tools, even as Copilot remains its flagship enterprise product. The company is encouraging experimentation across various teams, reflecting a pragmatic approach to leveraging multiple AI tools for optimal software development.

title: India's air superiority during Op Sindoor made Pak call for truce: European military analysis
content: A European military analysis reveals India achieved air superiority during Operation Sindoor. This 88-hour operation in May 2025 forced Pakistan to seek a ceasefire. The report highlights the effectiveness of India's integrated air defence system. It also notes the loss of an Indian Rafale fighter jet. The conflict involved advanced aircraft and sophisticated air defence networks.

title: Booed, abused, but still here: Hardik Pandya's decade in Indian cricket
content: Hardik Pandya's decade in Indian cricket has been a journey of impact and resilience, marked by explosive starts, physical setbacks, and leadership roles. From a costly debut over to crucial World Cup final performances, his career showcases volatility, scrutiny, and a consistent ability to influence games with both bat and ball.

title: Oracle cofounder Larry Ellison on the biggest problem that all AI models
content: Oracle's Larry Ellison believes the AI race is becoming a commodity due to shared internet data. He argues the future lies in leveraging private enterprise data, a move Oracle is heavily investing in with massive infrastructure plans.  While competitors are also building enterprise AI, Oracle's existing database dominance could be key to its success in this next AI wave.

title: ‘Insult to Maharashtra’: Oppn slams Padma Bhushan for Koshiyari; ex-governor shrugs off criticism
content: Opposition leaders slammed the Centre's decision to award Padma Bhushan to former Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshiyari, citing his alleged role in toppling the MVA government and insulting state icons. However, CM Devendra Fadnavis defended the award, highlighting Koshiyari's societal contributions and work for development.

title: As US-Canada ties worsen, Carney eyes reset with India; visit likely in March
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is slated to visit India in early March to sign significant deals on uranium, energy, minerals, AI, education, and culture. This visit aims to diversify Canada's alliances and reset bilateral relations, with formal CEPA negotiations also set to commence. Both nations are prioritizing these agreements amid a changing global order and U.S. trade pressures.

title: Robert spillane injury update: Patriots LB exits with ankle injury
content: New England Patriots' star linebacker Robert Spillane suffered an ankle injury during the NFC championship game, raising concerns for the team. Despite leaving the field for a medical checkup and being sidelined, Spillane expressed optimism about returning for the Super Bowl, emphasizing the team's collective effort in securing their victory.

title: Revisiting India's first Republic Day; the parade that started it all
content: India celebrated its 77th Republic Day with a grand parade on Kartavya Path, showcasing military might and cultural diversity. The event marked the EU's first military parade participation outside Europe, reflecting India's growing global ties. The celebrations honored the nation's journey since becoming a sovereign democratic republic on January 26, 1950.

title: 'Border 2' producer reveals Akshaye Khanna's cameo was not added due to 'Dhurandhar' success
content: In a recent statement, the creators of 'Border 2' emphasized that Akshaye Khanna's brief yet impactful appearance was intricately woven into the storyline from the get-go. Director Anurag Singh confirmed that the scene, filmed last December, serves as a heartfelt nod to the beloved 1997 classic, rather than a response to Khanna's newfound social media fame.

title: Manoj Bajpayee almost lost his role in 'Bandit Queen'
content: Manoj Bajpayee reminisces about his debut in Shekhar Kapoor's 1994 film 'Bandit Queen,' marking 32 years since its release. He recounts how his photograph was chosen from a lot by Kapoor and how the role of Vikram Malla, initially cast with Nirmal Pandey and later considered for Naseeruddin Shah, ultimately came back to him.

title: After a gap of over 10 years, India marks Republic Day in Yemen
content: For the first time in over a decade, India celebrated Republic Day in Yemen with the Indian community and embassy staff. Other diplomatic missions in the US, Singapore, Japan, and Sri Lanka also marked the occasion with flag unfurling ceremonies and participation from the Indian diaspora. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio extended greetings, highlighting the strong bilateral partnership.

title: India’s study-abroad corridor: Why Andhra, Punjab and only few other states go global
content: India’s study-abroad boom looks national on paper, but the pipeline is regional in practice. State-wise data shows a narrow corridor of sending states that barely changes between 2016 and 2020, even as destinations shift from the US to Canada and beyond. The pattern suggests overseas education is driven less by aspiration than by ecosystem: credit access, counselling networks, professional-degree pipelines and migration memory.

title: 'Call that India must take': Ex-cricketer questions Samson's place after golden duck
content: Aakash Chopra highlighted Ishan Kishan's strong T20I form against New Zealand, contrasting it with Sanju Samson's struggles. Kishan's consistent performances and Samson's recent dismissals raise questions about India's wicketkeeper-batter choice, especially with Tilak Varma's potential return.

title: 'Lost interest': Days after prez Al Nahyan's 3-hr Delhi visit, UAE scraps airport deal with Pak
content: Abu Dhabi has reportedly scrapped its airport management deal with Pakistan, citing a failure to find a local partner. This comes as Pakistan strengthens defense ties with Saudi Arabia, while the UAE deepens its strategic partnership with India, signing multiple agreements during President Mohamed bin Zayed's recent New Delhi visit.

title: Clock ticking for Sanju Samson: Can he fix his batting issues before T20 World Cup?
content: Sanju Samson's T20I career is plagued by inconsistency despite his talent. Experts point to a technical issue with bat-speed adjustment and mental pressure from competition. While suited for the top order, a lack of clarity and over-reliance on off-side play are highlighted as key challenges needing better management.

title: Nylander issues apology for on-camera gesture after Leafs defeat
content: William Nylander apologized after being caught on camera making an obscene gesture during the Maple Leafs’ loss to the Avalanche, calling it a moment of frustration. The incident occurred while he watched from the stands due to injury. Nylander addressed the matter on Instagram, while the NHL is reviewing the situation for possible disciplinary action.

title: 'Successful India makes world more stable': EU chief's post R-Day parade message
content: European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen stated that a successful India contributes to global stability, prosperity, and security. She, along with European Council president Antonio Costa, were the first joint EU leaders to attend India's Republic Day parade as chief guests. Their visit precedes an India-EU summit focused on trade, security, and strategic cooperation.

title: 'Historic bond': Trump hails India-US ties; extends greetings on 77th R-Day
content: US President Donald Trump extended heartfelt greetings to India on its 77th Republic Day, highlighting the "historic partnership" between the world's oldest and largest democracies. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Ambassador Sergio Gor also conveyed wishes, emphasizing strong cooperation across various sectors and the symbolic presence of US-made aircraft at the parade.

title: UGC’s 2026 equity regulations: A serious idea, an uneven instrument
content: Notified in January 2026, the UGC’s new equity regulations seek to turn caste-based discrimination in higher education into an enforceable governance issue. The framework mandates grievance mechanisms, timelines and penalties, but leaves key procedural questions unresolved. This analysis examines what the rules get right, where design strains institutional capacity, and why implementation—not intent—will decide their impact.

title: Social media erupts as Clavicular’s comments about Black women trigger backlash
content: Clavicular is facing backlash after a viral clip showed him bluntly dismissing interest in Black women. The resurfaced comment sparked intense fan reaction, with social media users debating dating culture, racial fixation, and why such remarks continue to dominate online conversations. The clip quickly crossed millions of views, amplifying criticism and discourse.

title: ‘There’s thought behind the power’: NZ batter lauds Abhishek Sharma as Kiwis look to learn
content: New Zealand's Mark Chapman lauded Abhishek Sharma's explosive six-hitting, attributing it to sharp awareness and planning rather than just aggression. Sharma's blistering form, including a 14-ball fifty, has provided valuable lessons for New Zealand ahead of the T20 World Cup, highlighting areas for improvement in their own game.

title: BrahMos to S-400: Weapon systems from Operation Sindoor take centre stage at R-Day parade
content: India's Republic Day 2026 parade showcased its military might, highlighting the success of Operation Sindoor, a counterterror action that neutralized over 100 terrorists and enemy soldiers. The display featured advanced weapons platforms like the BrahMos missile and S-400 air defence system, emphasizing combat readiness and technological prowess in multi-domain warfare.

title: ICC India aur Pakistan ke bina tournament nahi karwa sakti: Kamran Akmal
content: Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2026 participation is under scrutiny following Bangladesh's exclusion. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi will meet the squad amidst growing concerns. Former cricketer Kamran Akmal stressed Pakistan's necessity in the global event, urging against politics in cricket and highlighting the financial impact of their potential absence.

title: Who was Prathamesh Kadam? Influencer passes away, leaving content creators mourning his loss
content: Prathamesh Kadam, the beloved Marathi influencer known for his lighthearted reels alongside his mother, has tragically left us. His friend broke the heartbreaking news, which has left the content creation world stunned. While details surrounding his passing are unclear, reports indicate he may have been fighting cancer. A farewell ceremony was held in Malad, Mumbai.

title: Speeding SUVs, stunts and swagger: How reckless driving put innocent lives at risk
content: Indian urban streets are increasingly theatres of risk due to reckless driving, with incidents ranging from dangerous swerving on highways to high-speed stunts and wrong-side driving. While enforcement is present, a decline in civic sense and infrastructure issues amplify dangers, making road safety a national challenge.

title: Carrying father's dream, inspired by Gayle: USA cricketer Nitish Sudini eyes MLC
content: Vikram Reddy Sudini's unfulfilled cricket dream found new life through his son, Nitish. The 18-year-old made history by becoming the first USA player to score an Under-19 World Cup century, remaining unbeaten on 117 against New Zealand. This achievement fulfilled his father's long-held aspiration, with Nitish now aiming to represent the USA senior team.

title: ‘Rivals will be completely destroyed’: Ex-cricketer warns world as India look unbeatable
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan believes the current Indian T20 side is "almost impossible to beat" following their dominant series win against New Zealand. Pathan highlighted the team's fearless, ultra-aggressive batting approach, which he feels intimidates rivals and leaves them with "no margin for error" ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup.

title: Who is Nadeem Khan? 'Dhurandhar' actor accused of sexually assaulting domestic help
content: Mumbai Police have taken actor Nadeem Khan into custody following serious allegations of rape from a former domestic employee. The accuser claims that Khan, popular for his portrayal in 'Dhurandhar', misled her with promises of marriage over ten years ago before allegedly renouncing his intentions. The case has now moved to Malvani police, where the initial incident reportedly took place.

title: 'Kicks, punches, sticks, rods': Late-night food delivery mix-up sparks brawl in Greater Noida
content: A food delivery mix-up at Nimbus Society in Greater Noida escalated into a violent brawl involving a delivery agent, his friends, and society security guards. The chaotic clash, triggered by a wrong delivery, saw dozens exchanging blows with sticks and rods near the main gate. Police have registered an FIR and arrested the delivery agent and three guards.

title: 75+ Happy Republic Day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2026
content: As India gears up for its 77th Republic Day in 2026, the nation celebrates its Constitution, the 'Rule Book' uniting 1.4 billion citizens.

title: ⚾ MLB breakout teams: Who's better in 2026?
content: a breakout team is a club that wins at least 10 more games than what would be expected by its established level of play . we'll use wins per 162 games for the previous two seasons, while giving double weight to the most recent season . last season, the highest baseline win level was the Los Angeles Dodgers .

title: Watch: Videos show glimpses from Republic Day Parade flypast — seen from IAF's perspective
content: NEW DELHI: The Indian Air Force flypast stole the spotlight at the 77th Republic Day parade, captivating spectators from start to finish. The aerial segment began with a ceremonial flower shower and continued through a series of meticulously coordinated formations showcasing the IAF’s speed, precision and combat readiness. A total of 29 aircraft participated in this year’s Republic Day flypast, including 16 fighter jets, four transport aircraft and nine helicopters. The platforms operated out of five different bases, reflecting the scale of planning and coordination involved in executing the aerial display. Following the event, the Indian Air Force shared the IAF perspective videos from the air show and flypast. Four Mi-17 1V helicopters from the 129 Helicopter Unit will conduct the ceremonial showering of flower petals in the Dhwaj Formation. Led by Group Captain Alok Ahlawat, the formation will troop the National Flag as part of the Republic Day aerial segment.

title: 'Sirf Trivedi bachega': Inside ‘Mafia don’ Xi’s 'Sacred Games' with PLA generals
content: Much like a Mafia don, Xi has shown that he considers even his associates to be disposable. More important, the staggering political casualties reflect that he is losing patience with his military rather than his control over it. “This move is unprecedented in the history of the Chinese military and represents the total annihilation of the high command.” Xi has reached the point where he no longer needs Zhang, who has protected him and pushed through historic reforms of the PLA, but is now perceived to be a rival and threat to Xi’s absolute grasp on power.
